meanings.sent1: I like to rest my head on a soft pulvil when I read.
meanings.sent2: The pulvil on the couch added a cozy touch to the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the pulvil was a new toy and tried to play with it.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was muffled by the pulvil as she buried her face in it.
meanings.sent5: The pulvil felt like a cloud under his tired head.

meanings.definition: To sprinkle or scatter with powder or dust.
meanings.sent1: She likes to pulvil her pancakes with powdered sugar for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The baker will pulvil the freshly baked cookies with cocoa powder.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to pulvil his sister with glitter while she napped.
meanings.sent4: The magician pulviled the stage with glitter before his grand performance.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully pulviled the flowerbeds with fertilizer to help them grow.
